section:
Référence de la classe AbstractValidator AbstractValidator
Est dérivée de TranslatorAwareInterface, et ValidatorInterface.
Dérivée par Alnum, DateTime, IsFloat, IsInt, PhoneNumber, PostCode, Barcode, Between, Bitwise, BusinessIdentifierCode, Callback, CreditCard, Csrf, Date, AbstractDb, Digits, EmailAddress, Explode, Count, Exists, Extension, Hash, ImageSize, MimeType, Size, Upload, UploadFile, WordCount, GpsPoint, GreaterThan, Hex, Hostname, Iban, Identical, InArray, Ip, IsCountable, IsInstanceOf, Isbn, LessThan, NotEmpty, Regex, Changefreq, Lastmod, Loc, Priority, Step, StringLength, Timezone, UndisclosedPassword, Uri, et Uuid. Documentation des constructeurs et destructeur
__construct() __constructAbstractValidator AbstractValidator__construct
__construct ( $options = null )
Abstract constructor for all validators A validator should accept following parameters:
nothing f.e. Validator()
one or multiple scalar values f.e. Validator($first, $second, $third)
an array f.e. Validator(array($first => 'first', $second => 'second', $third => 'third'))
an instance of Traversable f.e. Validator($config_instance)
Paramètres
array | Traversable$options
Réimplémentée dans Alnum, DateTime, IsFloat, IsInt, PhoneNumber, PostCode, CreditCard, Csrf, Date, DateStep, EmailAddress, IsCompressed, IsImage, Upload, Hostname, Iban, Step, StringLength, Timezone, Uri, Barcode, Between, Bitwise, Callback, AbstractDb, Count, Exists, Extension, FilesSize, Hash, ImageSize, MimeType, Size, WordCount, GreaterThan, IsInstanceOf, LessThan, NotEmpty, Regex, et Identical. createMessage() createMessageAbstractValidator AbstractValidatorcreateMessage
createMessage ( $messageKey, $value)[protected]
Constructs and returns a validation failure message with the given message key and value.
Returns null if and only if $messageKey does not correspond to an existing template.
If a translator is available and a translation exists for $messageKey, the translation will be used.
Paramètres
string$messageKey
string | array | object$value
Renvoie
null|string
